org.jpws.pwslib.data

Interface PwsBlockInputStream


  • public interface PwsBlockInputStream
    Interface defines a low-level read streaming device of data blocks of a fixed length. Depending on the encryption technology used in the linked PWS file, the size of atomic data blocks may vary.

    A PwsBlockInputStream always refers to a decryption process executed on a source PWS file. The blocks readable to the user are the complete sequence of decrypted data segments as defined by the underlying file cipher, in the order as they are encountered in the source. No interpretation or modification is performed on these data blocks by the streaming instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this input stream.
      int getBlockSize()
      The data block size of this stream.
      int getCount()
      The number of blocks already read from this input stream.
      PwsChecksum getStreamHmac()
      Returns the checksum object that summarises all read cleartext data through this block stream.
      boolean isAvailable()
      Whether there is more data to be read from this stream.
      byte[] peekBlock()
      Reads the next available block from this stream without progressing reading from the source.
      byte[] readBlock()
      Reads the next block of decrypted data from this input stream.
      byte[] readBlocks(int blocks)
      Reads a specified number of blocks from this input stream.
      void setStreamHmac(PwsChecksum hmac)
      Sets the operative checksum object for summarising read cleartext data of this block stream.
      int writeBlocks(byte[] buffer, int start, int length)
      Writes the given length of data from a number of remaining blocks to the specified buffer address.

    • Method Detail

      • isAvailable

        boolean isAvailable()
        Whether there is more data to be read from this stream.

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        The number of blocks already read from this input stream.
        Returns:
        int number of blocks starting from 0

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        The data block size of this stream.
        Returns:
        int block size

      • readBlock

        byte[] readBlock()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next block of decrypted data from this input stream.
        Returns:
        byte[] data block or null if the end of the stream has been reached
        Throws:
        java.io.EOFException - if the file length is irregular (blocking error)
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • readBlocks

        byte[] readBlocks(int blocks)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a specified number of blocks from this input stream. (Note: If EOFException is thrown, the stream has reached its end but a number of blocks read by this method are lost for the user. Hence requested blocks should belong to a single semantical unit.)
        Parameters:
        blocks - int number of data blocks to be read
        Returns:
        byte[] decrypted data block of size blocks * getBlockSize() or null if there is no more data available
        Throws:
        java.io.EOFException - if the remaining file length is insufficient for the requested data size
        java.io.IOException

      • writeBlocks

        int writeBlocks(byte[] buffer,
                int start,
                int length)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given length of data from a number of remaining blocks to the specified buffer address. The returned amount of blocks read are dropped from the stream.
        Parameters:
        buffer - byte[] output buffer
        start - int offset in buffer
        length - int number of bytes to be written
        Returns:
        int number of blocks read from the stream
        Throws:
        EOFException - if the stream run out of blocks
        java.io.IOException - if a reading error occurs

      • peekBlock

        byte[] peekBlock()
        Reads the next available block from this stream without progressing reading from the source. Repeated calls to this method will render the same logical block (although not the same object).
        Returns:
        byte[] next block of this stream or null if unavailable

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this input stream. After close no more data can be read from this stream.

      • getStreamHmac

        PwsChecksum getStreamHmac()
        Returns the checksum object that summarises all read cleartext data through this block stream.
        Returns:
        PwsChecksum

      • setStreamHmac

        void setStreamHmac(PwsChecksum hmac)
        Sets the operative checksum object for summarising read cleartext data of this block stream.
        Parameters:
        hmac - PwsChecksum
